trustfund: TF022976-DANISH CTF FOR L-T STUDIES: AGRICULTURE

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Agriculture Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project (ASAL) are to: 1) promote transition
            to a more sustainable and efficient use of resources,
            particularly water; and 2) free up markets and enable the
            private sector to invest, produce and trade in line with
            Jordan's comparative advantage in agriculture.  The
            project has three main components.  First, efficient natural
            resource use will support the transition to an optimal use
            of water and land resources.  Within an intersectoral water
            policy framework, ASAL supports comprehensive reforms to: 1)
            restructure water sector institutions to maximize efficiency
            and unify planning and management; 2) promote efficient use
            of existing water resources through demand management; 3)
            establish control on over-exploited groundwater resources;
            and 4) prioritize public investments in water.  Second,
            market liberalization will free up markets and thus
            encourage private investment and trade to flourish.  The
            adjustment program supported by ASAL provides for
            improvements to the incentive structure through the removal
            of subsidies and price controls, liberalization of external
            trade and lifting of monopolies.  Internal and external
            markets in agricultural produce will be deregulated, and
            there will be deregulation of markets in services and land.
            Third, institutional development will assure efficient
            public investment and service provision between the
            Government and the private sector.
